instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.CPU_VR_EN: What is CPU_VR_EN? CPU_VR_EN is an enable signal for CPU VCORE that is present when it is high. Signals with EN on the end enable whatever came before the EN if the signal is high. Signals with EN on the end enable whatever came before the EN if the signal is high. ALL_SYS_PWRGD, PM_RSMRST_L, PM_SLP_SUS_L, and PM_SLP_S3_L are necessary prerequisites for CPU_VR_EN to be present. .

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
Hello,
I am facing an issue with a mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a mother board.
When i connect the board on power supply the current go to 100mA and immediatelyfall and stay at 30 mA.
The green and orange light is present on the charger but i don't have a fan spin.
As i have a green light G3H lines are presents.
More over i have all S5 power rails active on the board.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.55V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3,41V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 4.97V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.31V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 3.31V
but i don't have S4,S3 and S0 voltages.
I tested for shorts but everything seems good.

When i measure S4,S3 and S0 power rails during the boot sequence (that means when current jump to 100 mA on the power supply), I can see a jump on each lines, that means the board try to enable voltages from S4 to S0 but turn off everything immediately except for S5 power rails

Can someone help me please,
thx,
Vincent

PS: no sign of liquid damage on the board

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

You should try starting in SMC bypass mode as first step.

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check every time what happen on all secondary power rails.
Do not forget pages 57/58.
Check for short, where you don't catch a pulse.
Also check for pulse at pins 7 & 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.
VCORE pulsing too?

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
bypass mode is that when you try to boot pressing ctrl+alt+shift keys ?
If thats true i already tried it

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
Is not that and was so many times explained on the forum; even Google has an idea about it.
Press power button, connect charger and maintain button pressed 5-10s; it should start with fan at max.
You can use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button.

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
thx for your answer, I will let you know

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
When i boot the device in smc bypass mode, the fan start spinning but stop directly
thx,
Vincent

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message: Now try the options mentioned 2 posts back.

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
Okay i did it but i did not found a non pulsing rail but pin 7 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> is pulsing so i think that means S0 lines can all be powered on
but pin 3 is not pulsing

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
I suppose you don't get any pulse at pin 6, just on 5 only.
VCORE must pulse, check that (L7310/20).
If yes and still no pulse at pin 6, then try a trick: tie pins 5/6 together (solder blob) and test the board.

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message: I just check if VCORE was pulsing on L7310 and L7320 but its not pulsing

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
Any pulse at <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_EN</SIGNAL>?
Also check voltage for pins 16 & 17 of <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>.

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CPU_VR_EN</SIGNAL>  is not pulsing
pin 16 go to 5V but fall to 0.1V pin 17 have constant 8.54V

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
Try known good working BIOS, just in case.
Several links for clean ME files are already posted on the forum.

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no boot
threads.message:
Hi I didn't test yet for BIOS issue but I came with an other good clue for debug I think.
Customer told me that the macbook was starting up by itermittence before and now don't want to boot.
